schema:name: PF Organisation Ontology Glossary v2.1
schema:description: Comprehensive glossary of all entities, properties, and relationships in the Platform Common Organisation Ontology

hasDefinedTerm.name: Organisation
hasDefinedTerm.description: Core entity representing any business, government, or organizational entity in a platform ecosystem. This is the foundational entity for all organizational relationships.
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use as the base type for any organizational entity. Every organization instance should be of type pf:Organisation or one of its subtypes.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Any company, institution, or organization that your platform interacts with - whether as a prospect, client, partner, or competitor.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: An RDF resource of type pf:Organisation, which extends schema:Organization with platform-specific properties for discovery, assessment, and relationship management.
constraints: Must have at least one platformContext
Must have at least one relationshipType
relationships: Can have one or more Addresses
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use this entity as the primary unit for discovery, enrichment, and analysis. Agents progressively populate properties through phases P1-P16, starting with basic identification and advancing to strategic assessment.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Organisation ID
hasDefinedTerm.description: Unique identifier for an organization within the platform system. This is the primary key for organization records.
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Every organization must have a unique orgId. Format is: {BatchLetter}{BatchNumber}-{SequenceNumber}
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: The unique reference number used to identify and track an organization across all platform systems.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Primary identifier property, immutable after creation, must match the specified pattern and be unique across all organization instances.
constraints: Must be unique across all organizations
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: Agents use orgId as the primary key for all lookups and references. This ID is used to link organizations across different data sources and systems.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Platform Context
hasDefinedTerm.description: Specifies which platform module(s) or service line(s) this organization is associated with.
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: An organization can be associated with multiple platform modules if they use multiple services. At least one platform context must be specified. Values are implementation-specific.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Which platform product/service line this organization is using or being targeted for.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: String property indicating platform association. Allows multiple values to support cross-service customers. Platform implementers should define their own values.
constraints: Values should be defined by platform implementer
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: Agents use platformContext to determine which discovery and assessment workflows to apply. Different platform modules may have different focus areas and qualification criteria.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Discovery Status
hasDefinedTerm.description: Composite object tracking the progressive discovery and enrichment of organization data through 16 phases.
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Every organization must have a discoveryStatus object tracking its enrichment progress. This guides agent processing and data quality assessment.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: How complete and verified is our information about this organization.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Complex object containing phase (P1-P16), completeness percentage, lists of populated and required fields. Drives agent workflow prioritization.
constraints: dataPopulated and dataRequired lists must be mutually exclusive
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: The discoveryStatus is the primary mechanism for agent coordination. Agents check this object to determine what work needs to be done, update it as data is discovered, and use it to calculate completeness metrics.
